articles.author: Isabelle Barth
articles.title: Salariat : « C’est maintenant le contrat psychologique qui prévaut dans la relation professionnelle »
articles.description: Depuis l’épidémie de Covid-19, les aspirations des salariés ont fortement changé, et celles-ci ne se limitent pas au télétravail, observe la professeure en sciences du management Isabelle Barth, dans une tribune au « Monde ».
articles.content: Tribune. La rentrée professionnelle samorce et, déjà, il est clair que plus rien ne sera comme avant la pandémie due au Covid-19. Un constat est que le « contrat psychologique » devient le nouveau mo… [+2749 chars]

articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.title: Colleges expect spike in random selection
articles.description: High-points courses in health, law, pharmacy and science most likely to be affected
articles.content:
Universities fear they will have to restrict entry to more high-points courses on the basis of random selection this year due to record-breaking Leaving Cert results.

articles.author: Lisa Richwine
articles.title: Critics say 'Dune' movie will thrill ardent fans, may mystify others
articles.description: The much-anticipated movie remake of science-fiction epic "Dune" won praise from critics on Friday for its stunning visual spectacle, though some of the initial reviews said that only the most hard-core fans would enjoy the storytelling.
articles.content: LOS ANGELES, Sept 3 (Reuters) - The much-anticipated movie remake of science-fiction epic "Dune" won praise from critics on Friday for its stunning visual spectacle, though some of the initial review… [+2088 chars]

articles.author: Wired
articles.title: Richard Lewontin Leaves a Legacy of Fighting Racism in Science
articles.description: The late evolutionary biologist made a reputation—and enemies—by speaking out against the idea that genes are destiny. Science still needs people like him.
articles.content: When Donald Trump invoked genetics at a campaign rally in Minnesota in September 2020, commentators were quick to connect his language to the eugenics and Nazi science of the early 20th century. You … [+4259 chars]

articles.author: Anjani Jain, Jeffrey Sonnenfeld
articles.title: A tale of two governors: COVID outcomes in Florida and Connecticut show that leadership matters
articles.description: Florida's spiking hospitalization and COVID death rates show what happens when ideology trumps science on mask mandates and vaccinations.

articles.author: Nadia Drake
articles.title: How these feuding map-makers shaped our fascination with Mars
articles.description: One was an artist who loved space. His rival was a bold professional astronomer. Their race to map the red planet sparked decades of science and speculation.

articles.title: Episode 3: Why War Zones Need Science Too
articles.description: Undaunted by Yemen’s civil war, National Geographic explorer Ella Al-Shamahi searches on the island of Socotra for traces of the earliest known humans to leave Africa.
